edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores all Nodes and Edges for use in graph algorithms. Additionally stores its own GraphState that will be used to store changes made to the Graph from compiling and running algorithms on the Graph.
    Author:
    Michael Owoc, Ty Devries (modifications by Matt Stallmann) $Id: Graph.java 113 2015-05-05 15:31:47Z mfms $

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      GraphWindow graphWindow 
      static java.lang.String NOT_A_COLOR
      NOT_A_COLOR is used when no color is specified; when the GraphElement is drawn on the panel NOT_A_COLOR is rendered as the default color (black); in other situations (e.g., when converting to text), it may be omitted
      static java.lang.String NOT_A_LABEL 
      static java.lang.Double NOT_A_WEIGHT

      • NOT_A_COLOR

        public static final java.lang.String NOT_A_COLOR
        NOT_A_COLOR is used when no color is specified; when the GraphElement is drawn on the panel NOT_A_COLOR is rendered as the default color (black); in other situations (e.g., when converting to text), it may be omitted

      • Graph

        public Graph(boolean directed,
     java.util.List<Node> nodes,
     Node rootNode)
        Constructor to instantiate a directed graph with a given List of nodes and a given root Node
        Parameters:
        directed - true if the Graph is directed, false otherwise
        nodes - a list of all of the nodes in the Graph
        rootNode - the root Node of the Graph

      • getNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> getNodes()
        Returns:
        all nodes in the graph; this version can only be used when there is no algorithm running; some nodes may not yet exist; inScope() without the 'state' argument only checks to see if a node has been deleted.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(int sourceId,
           int targetId)
        Adds a new Edge to the Graph with the specified source and target Node IDs and increments the GraphState Note: for undirected Graphs, "source" and "target" are meaningless.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source Node
        targetId - the ID of the target Node

      • addEdge

        public Edge addEdge(Node source,
           Node target)
        Adds a new Edge to the Graph with the specified source and target Nodes and increments the GraphState Note: for undirectedGraphs, "source" and "target" are meaningless.
        Parameters:
        source - the source Node
        target - the target Node
        Returns:
        the Edge added
